qas.question: In what year did Egypt get a new constitution?
What was the political party arrangement of the new constitution?
What was the dominant political party?
From what group did the National Union originate?
Who did Nasser want more involved in his new political order?

context: In January <a0_0>1956<a0_0/>, the new Constitution of Egypt was drafted, entailing the establishment of a <a1_0>single-party system<a1_0/> under the <a2_0>National Union<a2_0/> (NU), a movement Nasser described as the "cadre through which we will realize our revolution". The NU was a reconfiguration of the <a3_0>Liberation Rally<a3_0/>, which Nasser determined had failed in generating mass public participation. In the new movement, Nasser attempted to incorporate more <a4_0>citizens<a4_0/>, approved by local-level party committees, in order to solidify popular backing for his government. The NU would select a nominee for the presidential election whose name would be provided for public approval.
